intro: Dicliptera inconspicua, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dicliptera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swampy areas. The plant features slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a smooth surface. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually greenish-white and clustered in dense inflorescences. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
